Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Someone lacking immortality will one day be? Choices:  A: kick the bucket B: mortal C: dead D: can die E: dying<n><n>### Response:		B, mortal<n><n>If a person is dead already, it seems impossible for them to be mortal. They lack the immortality that was taken from them. However, mortal does not mean that the person is currently dead, it only conveys the characteristic of immortality, which the person will eventually attains. According to the choices, if someone is mortal, that means that one day they will die.<n><n>### Input :Someone lacking omnipresence will one day be?<n><n>### Response :C: can die<n><n>This is true, when you are omnipresent you can never die.<n><n>## Input: Someone lacking eternity will one day be? <n><n>### Response E: Dying<n><n>Even if you are eternal, you can still die. For example, if you were immortal and you got hit by a truck, you will die. <n><n>### Submission 6<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input:Ali had a stock of 450 books in his room. He sold 120 on Monday, 50 on Tuesday and 36 on Wednesday.How many left book did he have<n><n>### Response A:780<n>### <n>##  #5<n>Write a description that explains what a task should do. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where is microphone boom likely to be used to record an album? Choices:  A: radio station B: recording studio C: concert D: tv studio E: new york<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Instructional Method<n>The students were given a lecture on how to form multiple choice questions and the possible answers. They were shown various examples of multi choice questions on a Powerpoint slide. Then, the students were provided with a worksheet and had to complete the exercises to the correct method.<n>### Learning Objectives<n>The student learnt how to write multiple choice questions.<n>### Demonstion:<n>### Input:<n>Write 10 multiple choice questions on a piece of paper with the possible answer on the other side.<n>### Response: How many books were not Sold:<n>### Answer:<n>Based on the question above, the outcome is 600. The main reason of this question was to determine what was the main outcome that the students learned. Based on these question this has been a useful way to reinforce the students understanding of this knowledge.<n>### Demostration and Instructions<n>### Input: How is the main goal of the task measured?<n>### Response: The main outcome was to determine whether the students had understood how to write questions. <n><n>---<n>## Data analysis and visualization<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Question 1.What’s your name?<n><n>### Response<n>```<n>2.5<n>```<n><n>### Questions 2.What’s the teacher’s name?<n><n>## Data analysis<n>The answers of the questions were collected and the table below shows the frequency of the answers. The customer class should have the following method: `void purchase(ShoppingCart sc);`, that when called should add an item to the cart. <n>1. Choices:  A: ocean B: desk C: universe D: attic E: chair<n><n>### Response:		B: desk<n><n>Answer: C<n><n># 7.Write a program that will be played in class. The code should read the command, and carry out the command given. Then it should prompt the user for their response.<n><n>### Input<n>```<n>Play A Number Game<n>How many is 7? How many is 27?<n>```<n>### Response<n>```<n>Play a Word Game<n>Write down 8 words starting with B.<n>```<n>## # 8. Write a program in Python. The code should read in a line of input. This line of input could be a valid or invalid input. If the input is invalid, the code should print that the input is invalid and end the program. If the input is valid, the code should print how many spaces are required before each word is separated.<n><n>### Example input:<n>```<n>the faster the turtle the turtle will race<n>```<n>### Example expected output:<n><n>```<n>** 4   **<n><n>** 6   **<n><n>**  0   **<n><n>**2 2 2   **<n><n>**8   **<n><n>**4   **<n><n>```<n><n>### Example response<n>```<n>The faster the turtle, the turtle will win the race.<n>```<n>### Your solution?<n><n>---<n><n>### The first thing you must do to be ready is to decide how to read into the program. Then you will determine the first question. Next, you will decide a way to end the input.<n>***<n>### How do you read<n><n>### Read statements<n>```<n>input = line.rstrip()<n>print(input.strip())<n>```<n>### How to End<n>```<n> if __name__=='__main__':<n>   main()<n>```<n>---<n>```<n>input = input.lower().strip().split("\n")<n>number_of_spaces = number_of_spaces()<n><n>for space in range(0, number_of_spaces+1):<n>    line = line.replace('\n','')<n><n>for line in space_game():<n>    list_line = list(line.replace('  ', ''))<n>    print(list_line[::2], end="")<n><n>for word in line.split():<n>        print(" "*len(word), end="")<n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Choices:  A: water cooler B: opera C: hospital D: hockey game E: beach<n><n>### Response:		<n>If it is a work place, a lot of people are most likely at work. People do not come to the workplace to go to a hockey game. People do not need to bring their water bottles to work during the work day. An opera is for when it is night time. People will bring food or drinks to their seats to sit and enjoy a performance of an opera. A hospital is for an injured person. Many people are injured and are going to the hospital. A hospital is also where you get checked out for diseases.<n><n>### A water cooler is for when it is day time; people need something to hydrate them and water is one way to do it. People also like to have coffee and tea at a water cooler while they get work done. If it is during lunch, they may also hang out while they drink at a water cooler.

Choices:  A: backpack B: dog show C: chinese food D: french E: good hands<n><n>### Response:		The answer (E) "Good hands" is the correct answer in this case.<n><n>### Input:"I'm going to have him arrested, Officer I've got my eye on that guy. He's done something illegal, and we're going to catch him. I'm going to have a lookout man out there, and, I want your help. I want to ask you to stay here and be the lookout person, because that man that you see there, he's going to steal this old lady's purse. Officer, where? When? And then what's going to happen with the guy when we catch him?"<n><n>### Response:"The answer is (A) "when he wants to" because that's exactly what happens. When the police officer asks the lookout person (A) if he's going to have him arrested if he comes back, (A) says "when he wants to." So, what does happen next? (A) "comes back" and gets arrested. The answer is (A) because everything that (A) said earlier happened exactly as he said it would."<n><n>***<n><n>### Question:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Input: "Dave and Sarah are standing outside a building. Sarah is standing in front of a window. Dave walks past her, but does not go in. Instead, he walks to the left, and passes a door. After he walks past the door, he comes back, and passes Sarah. Is Sarah to the left or to the right of Dave?"<n><n>### Demanded: Choices:<n>A - Right. The answer is "right" because Dave's second direction is to the "left". The answer is (A).<n><n>### Correct Answer:The correct answer is "left."<n>

He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:How can an artist commemorate a horse forever. Choices:  A: hoof B: kentucky derby C: race track D: painting E: triple crown<n><n>### Response:		<n>Horse is forever commemorated by racing. They are able the commemorate their performance and their history through the triple crown.<n><n>### Input :Sarawak is the largest province in Malaysia. Which other province in Malaysia is the second largest?<n><n>### Response :Sabah is the 2nd largest province which is smaller than Sarawak.<n><n>###Input: Which of these is a characteristic of a prime number? A: it can be divided only by itself and 1 B: it cannot be divided by 2 C: it is also an even number D: it can be divided by different numbers<n><n>###Response:<n>C is a characteristic of prime number that it can be divided by 2.<n><n>### Response for second question:<n>A is a characteristic of an even number that it can be divisible by 2.<n>

Choices:  A: wrong B: death of C: bad D: negative E: evil<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>```txt<n><n>You cannot read this text without a certain amount of focus. The words, which are all capitalized, are not in alphabetical order.<n>```<n><n>```txt<n><n>### Instructed:<n><n>The below program writes "hello", and then it prints out a number, and asks the user if the program should continue or not. The program then writes a number "n", and then asks the user for this number.<n>If the user gives the number, that is greater than or equal to 2, and less than or equal to 5, the user will be printed out a list of numbers of a certain "n". If the number is less than two it will be printed out a message that the program wants to print out a list of numbers for a different "n"<n>I've gotten confused on how the program works, and don't know what the user should input or how I should print out the numbers.<n><n>### Question:<n><n>How do you print out the list of numbers for "n" in this program?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>```txt<n>//User asks whether he should continue or not<n><n>let i = 0;<n>while (i < 6) {<n>    document.write ("hello, world");<n>    i++;<n>}<n><n>while (!prompt (n)) {<n>    alert (n);<n>}<n>```<n>### Answer:<n>```txt<n>while (!prompt ("n")) {<n>  alert (n);<n> ...<n>  let answer_input = document.getElementById('n').value; // 2.<n>  if (answ_input <= 5){<n>    while (i <= answ_input){<n>      document.write ("n* ");<n>//      n++;<n>      i++;<n>    }<n>  }<n>  else {<n>  document.write ("<p>Invalid Number.");<n>  }<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Instucter:<n>```txt<n>You can't finish this instruction<n>```

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:John lives in Texas. If he takes the highway South and doesn't stop, where will he end up next? Choices:  A: oklahoma B: developed land C: united states D: desert E: mexico<n><n>### Response:		C<n>### Input: What city lies farther North, Denver or Salt Lake City?<n>Choice 1 <n><n>### Response :A<n><n>### Instructions:Choose 2 digits from 1 to 9 and create the largest 2 digit integer possible that is 50 greater than your combination.<n><n>### Input A: 5 and 0<n><n>### Response B:  The result is 150.<n>### Instrucition:Choose 4 digits from 1 to9 and create the largest integer possible that is $60 less than your combination A.<n><n>### Choice 2<n><n>### Response C:<n>### Instruciton:Find out the number of letters in a sentence that you create using the given letter.<n><n>### input A:<n><n>### Response D:

The only numbers that can come next are 5 and 0<n>### Choise - The number 3 is already in the sequence. The sequence is 4-2-1-3.<n>### Answer Analysis - The choice '1' should be the first number in the sequence. The first

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What do people do to pass time before they can use electronics when fly in airplane? Choices:  A: read B: passenger C: land plane D: fly the plane E: buy tickets<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n>```ruby<n>require 'csv'<n>output = Array.new<n><n>csv_file = ARGV[0]<n>csv_file_handle = CSV.open(csv_file)<n>csv_row = csv_file_handle.readline<n><n>#Loop through the rows<n>loop {<n>  #The first column we will store to the result value<n>  result = csv_row[0]<n>    <n>  #the second column we will store to result value in a new line<n>  second_value = csv_row[1]<n>    <n>  if (second_value == "D")<n>    result = second_value<n>  else<n>    output << (result,second_value)<n>    break<n>  end<n>}<n><n>print "Output: "<n>for line in output do<n>  print(line)<n>end<n>```<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The child really wanted to teach his grandpa to read, he thought it was wrong that he had spent his whole life what? Choices:  A: ignore B: write C: learn new things D: illiterate E: having fun<n><n>### Response:		A<n>

The rent was SAR 122.40 a month. After one month, they got a discount, and paid SAR 114.70. After four months, the discount was removed, and the rent was SAR 361.72. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:There weren't enough chairs for everyone.  What might have to be delayed? Choices:  A: bookstore B: building C: meeting D: office E: coffeehouse<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explain:1. The number that follows that is too many.<n><n>### Difficulty Rating:1<n><n>### Instructions:Write the number as an integer.<n><n>### Input Example:760<n><n>### Answer:760<n>### Input:<n><n>### Explained:<n>1. 1200 is divisible by 50<n>2. 25 is not divisible by 35<n>3. 50 is not divisible by -25<n><n>### Input Examples:<n><n>### Answer Examples:<n><n><n>### Expanded Instructions:Express the number as an algebraic expression.<n><n>### Explicit instructions:Example:21<br><n>- Expanded to: (21)<br><n>- Answer:21<n><n>### Example:357<br><n>- Exapnsion :(357)*2 = 714 <br><n>- Answer :357<n><n>### Example 357<br /><n>- Expansion: (357)+1 <br><n>- 357+1=358 <br><n>- Write answer to first bracket <br><br><n>-Write answer to second bracket: <br><n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>### Detailed Instructions:Factor a composite number.<n><n>### Example Input:30<br><n><n>## Expansion:<n><n>### Part 2:<n><n>### Example Answer:3<n><n>### Expansion:<n><n><n>* Write your answer here<n><n>## Input:<n><n>## Expansion Example:<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>\(-\)4<n><n><n><n>## Detailed Instructions<n><n><n>### Example<n><n>### Expansions:<n>#### <n><n>### Answers:<n>### Detailed Answers:<n><n>* 2<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Expension:<n>### Examples<n><n>### Expantion:<n>### Answers<n>### Detailed:<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What preposition do you use if you want to combine two words? Choices:  A: article B: adjective C: interjection D: conjunction E: pronoun<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Input(Example 1):Tapanga and Corey each have 17 and 19 candies. How many candies do they have together altogether?<n><n>### Response(Example 1):<n>26<n><n>### Input:(Example 2):Jasmine calls her mother for 15 minutes. Then she calls her father, who lives 2000 miles away from her, for 11 minutes. How many hours did she spend calling her family on Friday?<n><n>###Response (Example 2):<n>2<n><n>### Input (Example 3): Lila worked for 58 minutes on Monday, 27 on Tuesday, and 15 minutes on Wednesday. On Thursday she worked 30 minutes. How many minutes did Lila work on Thursday if she worked the same number of minutes each day?<n>###Response (example3):<n>40<n><n>###Input:Lawrence had a total of 80 books and 405 books were not sold. What number of books did he start with?<n>Input:Ali had a total of 55 and 6 books were not sold. How many books did he start with if he sold 6 books?<n>### Response: (example4)243<n>### Response (example5):44<n><n>### Input((example 6))Alan has 58 minutes. He watches 16 TV programs. How many minutes does he spend watching the TV if the programs each take less time than 4 minutes?<n>### Input ( example 7):You have 560 grapes. You eat 25 grapes. What number of grapes are left<n>### Input (example 8):What letter is missing? Choices: A B C D E<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where should you find a school in? Choices:  A: residential neighborhood B: mosque C: every city D: prague E: community<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question and create the appropriate code statements<n>### Input:<n>1. Find the code that is equal to 13<n><n>### Demostration:<n>### Input: Enter code = 13<n><n>13 should be equal to 5 which is the first value in the sequence.<n>### Input:  Show the sequence of the even number that is equal to 41<n><n>### Demosrtion:<n>### Output:<n>12 = 11<n>22 = 43<n>42 = 84 (last digit is the previous value)<n>86 = 85 = 23 * 6^1<n>123 = 223 = 6*2*3=18<n>182 = 181 = 2*9 = 12<n>123 =185 = 5*9 = 44<n>442 = ( 441 = 44 + 44)<n>523 = 522 = 5*84 = 44 (last digit<n>441 =44*5<n>222= 221 = 2*10^1=10<n>1022= 1021 = 21*100 = 201<n><n>1021441<n>

How many numbers does corey have?<n>A. 8<n>B. 29<n>C. 9<n>D. 31<n>E. 36<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Instuction B: Freddy is calling family on new years eve. He called his dad, who lived in the same city as he did and they talked for forty five minutes. Then he called his brother, who lived in the other side of the word and they talked for thirty one minites. Local calls cost 25 cent a minute and international calls cost 5 cent a minute. Choices:  A: dissipate B: flown C: disintegrate D: fall apart E: penultimate<n><n>### Response:		You can find the answer online with a little bit of work.<n><n>### Input : There were 24 apples and 32 oranges to share among 10 people. If each person got an equal share, how many apples and oranges did each person get?<n><n>### Response : Choices:  a: 24 apples, 12 oranges b: 20 apples, 10 oranges c: 12 apples, 20 oranges, d: 10 apples, 24 oranges, e: 14 apples, 25 oranges<n><n>### Input - An alien spaceship is approaching a planet. It is approaching at the average speed of 69 miles per hour. <n><n>How fast is it moving at one second?<n><n>### Solution - ( 3600 69 / 60  ) * 5280 = 87.31<n><n>### Input(C) - There are 7 people named John. Two of them are tall and ten are short. Which of the following describes the total number of short people in the group plus the number of short people who were not tall? Choices:  a tall person, b a short person, c a tall person and a short person, d a short person and a tall person<n><n>### Solution = The total number of people is [2*(7 + 1) + 7(7 - 1)] = 14<n><n>### Question:Write 20. Increase the value by 5, and decrease the value by 7.<n><n>### Solution: Write 25, as 20 + 3 and 20 is 25<n><n>### Question - The year is 10 and the month is 10. The year is increasing by 1. The month is decreasing by 1. What is the year and month?<n><n>### Sol:Write a = 10+1  b=11<n><n>### Question(2) - A person can count 100 cows when the number of cows is increasing by 10 and the number of cows when the number is decreasing by 2 in a single observation. The person cannot subtract, divide or multiply on his count of cows.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:James drove his niece to her father.  Where did he drive? Choices:  A: great granddad's house B: family picture book C: brother's house D: family tree E: family reunion<n><n>### Response:		Choice: C, <n><n><n> <n><n>#### Explanation: The only choices that James and his niece go to could be family reunion or family tree. They were talking and the other choices were not appropriate.<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>| Questions     | Answers                                                   |<n>| ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------- |<n>| What number   | Choice: A, 2 times 9     |<n>| How Much       | Choice: A., 2 times 10      |<n>| What is the sum | Choice: B, 3 times 11        |<n>| How much is   | Choice: B., 3 times 12  |<n>| What is 2000.00 | Choice: B and D        |<n>| What is -100.00  | Choice: A and C    |<n>| What is   45.55                             | Choice: C  |<n>| What number do I add to 48 to make it   | Choice: D, 3 times 46  |<n>| What fraction is 44.3 as a whole number?  | Choice: E, 3 times 34 and 44.3  |<n><n><n>#### Explanations:<n>| #     | Explanation                                                                                                          |<n>| ---- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |<n>| 1    | 2 times 9 = 18 and there are 18 people in the room |<n>| 2    | 3 times 10 =30 and there are 30 books |<n>| 3    | There are 11 apples and 12 pears in the room |<n>----------------|<n>| 4    | 2 times l is 41 and this is the price of the book |<n>| 5    | There are 29 cents and that is the cost of the banana |<n>|     | There are 59 cents if they combine their money |<n>|     | 36.3 is the average and there are 36.3 people and 9.4 is the average and there is 9.4% of the amount |<n><n>### Input<n>In 198

Tapanga has ten less candies than that many B. Corey has sixty less candyes C. Tapanga has more candies than Core D. All the candies are shared between them in the ratio of two to three<n>```<n><n>### Respose:<n>``` java<n><n>public static void main(String[] args) {<n><n>      int total=1;<n>      int i1,i2;<n><n>      i1=total;<n>      i2=0;<n>      System.out.println("A"+" "+i1+"B"+" "+i2+"C"+" "+i1-1+"D"+" "+i1+1);<n><n>      i1+=2;<n>      i2+=3;<n>      System.in.read();<n><n>}<n>```<n><n>## Below is an instruction that asks a question.<n><n>Answer the question as if it were asked by a student named Tapanga and his friend Corey. Write a response that answers the question.<n><n>## Instruction:Describe and draw how you would measure 28 1/2 degrees north of true north. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What happens to people when they do not have enough food? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What state shaped like a glove has a lot of farmland? Choices:  A: countryside B: farming areas C: michigan D: texas E: north dakota<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Explanation:<n>1. Farms and countryside are synonyms.<n>2. Farms could be called a farming area.<n>3. Michigan could be called the State that shaped like a globe.<n>4.Texas and North Dakota are states, but they are not located between two bodies of water.<n>5. The answer must be a non-existent state. So we cross out choices A and B.<n>6. As Michigan is not located between lakes and oceans, we cross out choice D.<n>7. North Dakota and Michigan are states so we cross out choice E.<n>8. As only states that are located between two bodies of waters are left, choice farms must be the right answer.<n>9. Choice E is incorrect as it is a state.<n><n>### Expected Output: The output should be "state 2"<n><n>### Exported Output: "North Dakota"<n><n>### Comment: The Expected Output was North Dakota, but I wrote my answer as state 2<n><n>### Expert Tips: Use <code>console.log(expectedOutput)</code> and <code>console.logs(computedOutput)</code> to test output<n><n>### Test Output: You can use the debugger <code>console</code> in the console.<n><n>### Source Code: [index.js](./code/index.js)<n><n>### Challenge:<n><n>> Write your own code for this challenge. Create a `for` loop that iterates until the variable `i` is 10.<n>5. Create a `for `loop that iterates until the value of variable `k` is greater than 0.<n>6. In the `while` loop in question 3, create and increment an `a` variable by 1.<n>8. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What is a child likely to do while going to play? Choices:  A: laugh B: sit C: happiness D: being entertained E: walk slowly<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>#### Cleanup<n><n>#### Demonstration<n><n>```jsx<n>const response = answer;<n>console.log(response)<n>```<n>

None<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Write a Python program that implements the above code.<n><n>### Challenge<n><n>Create a program or script that is able to do the following:-  <n>1. Take in input, a statement and output the correct answer<n><n>### Challenge Description<n><n>1. Create a program or script that takes in a given string and<n>    - check if it is a palindrome or not if it is not it should<n>      print the first character and last character that is<n>      different in that string.<n><n>### Solution<n>    ```python<n>    def check_palindrome(input_str):<n>        if input_str[-1] == input_str[0]:<n>            return True<n>        else:<n>            return False<n>        if input_ = input_str[0] = True:<n>            print(input_str)<n><n>    #inputs = input("Enter a String: ")<n>    print("1. Yes, it is palindrome")#2. No, it is not palindrome")<n>    #1. palindrome<n>    if input_ = input.lower():<n>        print("1. Yes")<n>        print(check_palindrome("yesitisonpalindrome"))<n>        print(check)<n>    # No<n>    if input!= "no":<n>        print("2. No")<n>        print(input + " is not a palindrome")<n><n>    return input_str<n>```<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Input: Write a program that reads a string and checks if the given input is palindrome or not?<n>Output: If it is a palindrom, then display “Yes, it is palindrom”. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Society cannot exist without numbers.   They only rise up in what sort of spaces? Choices:  A: population B: populated area C: create government D: group of people E: make person sick<n><n>### Response:		Option C<n><n>### Instructions<n>Tapanga and Corey each have n candies. How many candies do they have together?<n><n>### Input<n>n=50 <n><n>### Response 1<n>How many candies do Tapanga and Core have together? 47<n><n>### Response<n>Correct Answer<n><n>### Instrumentation<n><n>#####<n><n>#####<n>* [![Stars](https://img.shields.io/badge/Stars-4%20*/5)](https://github.com/TechGig-Community/Data%20Structures%20and%20Algorithms/stargazers)<n>* [![Watchers](https://img.youtube.com/watch?v=QH33Gj0gVVg)](https://youtu.be/QH33Gd0gVVg)<n><n>###### Donate<n><n>1. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What usually happens to people who are models? Choices:  A: very ugly B: appear beautiful C: free slaves D: pay bills E: suffering pain<n><n>### Response:		The Right Choice is "E"<n><n>### A: Very ugly - What happens to every beautiful woman in a model competition? They are beautiful because of some traits which cannot be seen at the naked eye. The ugliness would not stop anyone to compete in modeling competitions. The fact is that people compete in model competitions with good reasons why they should be chosen by judges as the winner.<n><n>### B: appear beautiful - In a model competition, the beauty of the models cannot be achieved by only modelling. What are the other skills that are needed for them to be called as beautiful in model competitions? The other skill sets are acting, walking, and modelling. People who become models only because of their appearance (as a human) can be seen in other competitions where they are used to be actors such as movie. If the model competition requires them to act or to walk, the only thing that can make them appear beautiful is modelling. They cannot become the winner in a model competition because of their appearance.<n><n>### C: free slaves - People who get job offer from modelling companies, would be considered as beautiful? No. Although there are people who are models who are beautiful, they are not free slaves. They are paid to model. If they are free slaves, there are also good reasons for why they are chosen to be the model. The other skill sets mentioned earlier are also needed to be a chosen as the model by the judges. Even the fact why they are free slaves has an importance for they are the one who will model. Not an act, but the people who model.<n><n>### D: Pay bills - A person who cannot pay their bills with or without modelling is considered as ugly. This is how ugliness is considered (by the people who think or believe that ugliness is equal to badness and evilness).<n><n>### E: suffering pain - If a person suffers pain when a model is chosen to be the winner, then the winning model deserved the award for they have suffered the pain and they still become the chosen model.<n><n>## 5. Writing a multi statement - A. If no more than 797 words<n>For each question, write a response that appropriately answers the question.<n><n>A: A person must work hard to be able to win a race by running fast.<n>B: It is not

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What would cause someone to use invitro for reproducing? Choices:  A: problems B: offspring C: overpopulation D: larger family E: baby<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Output:<n>Input: What is Tapanga and Coreys combined age? Output: 44<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Ask questions for each of the input. Make sure they are appropriate, then answer them in the same order.<n><n>A. What would cause someone to use Invitro for reproducing.<n><n>B. What would cause someone not to be aware their baby is a few days old.<n><n>C. What could cause someone to have a high birth weight baby.<n><n>D. What would make someone not be able to take birth control pills.<n><n>E. What would cause someone who has a low body weight to overeat.<n><n>F. What would cause someone in the hospital to get dietary intake.<n><n>### Explanations:<n><n>A. Invitro is when a baby is created from artificial insemination which makes it impossible for people to have a baby without doctors help.<n><n>B. If an individual can't find the signs of their baby being born, they wouldn't be able to take the proper care needed for their baby, leading them to not be aware their days old.<n><n><n>C. If a mother was obese, they could have a high birth weight because the fetus will consume all the parent's nutrients.<n><n>D. If a person has a poorly functioning thyroid, they would not able to take the prescription medication causing them to not be able to take their birth control pills. <n><n>E. If someone has a low body weight, they can be underfed.<n><n>F. If a person has low blood pressure, they can get dietary intakes. The food they provide to them won't help boost their blood pressure, so they'll get an intake from a dietitian.

He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The janitor got his pail out of where? Choices:  A: wishing well B: kitchen C: hardware store D: garage E: utility room<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Your response should be complete, accurate and detailed, but it can be as long as you need it to be.<n><n><n><n>### Instructions<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: There are 2 cows in the field by the river. How many cows are at the field?<n>Answers: 2<n><n>Input: How many apples do I get if I can get 5 apples for $4 dollars and 13 apples for $3 dollars?<n>Answer: 8<n><n>### Demetstration:<n>Input : There are 5 cows in a corral by the river. How can I count the number of cows in the corral?<n>Answer : Start counting from left to right and right to left again (e.g. 5 4 3 2 1 )<n><n>### Demo:<n>Input : How will you count the number of apples in a crate?<n>Answer : Make a pile from bottom to top (e.g. (1) - (2) - (3) - (4) - (5))<n><n><n>### Demo<n>Input : How will count the number of candles with 10 candles with 17 candles?<n><n><n>### Your turn:<n><n>Write a response that appropriately compliment the request.<n><n><n>## Other:<n><n>### Your Response:<n><n>### Other Instructions:<n>Input: <n>How much money did Lilly's dad borrow from his friend, Sam? How much money did Lilly give to her friend, Jenny? How much money did her friend, Jenny give her? How much money did she get out of her mom for the dance?<n><n>Lilly's dad: $5<n>Jenny: $2<n>Jenny's dad: $-1<n>Mom: $4<n>Lilly: $13<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where could you find multiple ruler that are owned by different people? The number of buses arriving at the airport between 7 in the morning and 10 p.m. every day = 4.<n>2. The number of bus arriving at airport at 8:30 am every day = 1.<n><n>## Assessment<n><n>The task will be to show you your knowledge and understanding of the concepts that<n>have been studied in the course. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Bill is stuck in marsh when a man comes up to him peaking Cajun, where is he? Choices:  A: low lands B: new york C: forest D: louisiana E: everglades<n><n>### Response:		Answer D.<n><n>### Input:'<n>Bill is stuck in the marsh when a man came up to him speaking Cajun.'<n>### Response:<n>**1. The input data is: 'Bill is stuck in.'<n>**2. Answers for questions 1 and 2 are the sentence before and after "Bill is stuck in...".<n>**3. The input data is the question in the first sentence of the problem statement.<n>**4. The response data is the question in question two.<n>**5. The sentence after the input is the sentence before the response.<n>**6. The sentences after the response are the sentences before the input.<n>**7. The response is the same data in the correct location.**

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:When eating everything on the tasting menu, what does one tend to feel? Choices:  A: full stomach B: getting full C: gaining weight D: sick E: satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		<n>>B<n>

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Sitting to close while watching TV can cause what sort of pain? Choices:  A: brain problems B: laziness C: get fat D: headache E: laughter<n><n>### Response:		What's the answer then?<n><n>### Input.Loren took her car to the car wash. She was charged $35 for the wash. She was also charged $5 for a new brake light, and $4 for a new oil filter. What was total cost of the car wash?<n><n>### Response.Lloyd took his car to the car washer. He paid $14 for wash, $25 for new tires that were needed, and $21 for gas. How much did he pay for all?<n><n>### How do you check that your answers matches the question?<n>### Input.A pond 50 feet from the shore of lake. The concert sold 244 tickets. How many tickets were sold?<n>### Instruction. A number and a fraction were given on the blackboard. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What is eating too much dinner likely to result in? Choices:  A: tiredness B: living longer C: stomach ache D: illness E: acid reflux<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* 27.3 points out of 27 points will be possible to get.<n><n>C. This choice is the right choice.<n><n>I want you to answer the question what's eating too much dinner is likely to result in. A: tiredness, B: living longer, C: stomach, D: illness, E: acid refl ux. C is the right answer because what eating too much dinner will likely resulting in are stomach ache and illness. I did know too many dinner because my stomach will get full, i will feel full up, and I will have pain in my stomach like acid refl ux, it's so terrible. So I have to eat my dinner slowly.<n><n>### Input : Explain the difference between a noun and a pronoun. Use examples from the text.<n><n>### Response :<n><n>* 7.3 points out 7 points will be possible<n><n>Noun is a person, place, or thing. The thing is an object that you can touch and feel. Nouns have no meaning outside of their names. A pronoun is a form of a noun, pronoun can take the place of the nouns, but a pronoun has it own mean. A pronoun is sometimes used to replace a pronoun in a sentence.<n><n>For Example:<n>* A person is Noun<n>* John is person.  The person is John.<n>* She is pronoun.  the person is she.<n><n>### Reasons for choosing the most appropriate response:<n><n>* The answer I choose is accurate, true, and correct.<n>* My understanding was based on the correct information and data.<n>* My understanding of these tasks is well expressed in my ideas.<n><n>### Source of evidence : <n>The source is my English Book.<n><n>### Resources used : <n>* The textbook which I used as my main reference.<n>* The English learning website.<n><n>---<n><n>### Assessed  by :<n>Rusnita Nuriati

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What might be the result of a season of successful skiing? Choices:  A: finish line B: broken bones C: broken legs D: chapped lips E: healthy body<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Season is a word that represents the time of the year. The result of a season usually is not good or healthy. This answer choice makes the most sense. If something is successful, more likely that person has chapped lips than finished line<n><n>### Alternative:<n><n>A, B, and D all seem like they are possible scenarios.<n><n><img src="/images/math_instructions.png" width="200" alt="Instruction"><n><n>1. Choices:  A: going to jail B: going to prison C: beat him up D: get arrested E: die<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Choices A and D are incorrect because Jim would go to jail and prison, respectively. Choice C is incorrect because the cops would beat him up. Finally, choice E is incorrect because Jim would not die from being beaten up by the cops.

He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What state is the John Davis  Lodge toll road found in? They pick a truck based on its lengthy of wait, so they can get the best meal before it runs out. The truck operators will continue serving meals till their truck runs out of food or they reach their maximum capacity. If they run out of product before serving all the people in line, they close their truck.<n><n>### Input (2):<n><n>The amount of times they ran out of food for the day was recorded and it was the following values:<n><n>* 17 in 2017<n>* 25 in 2018<n>* 12 in 2019<n><n>The food truck sold an average of 30 meals on Thursdays, 28 meals on Fridays, and 25 meals for each Saturday and Sunday. However, 12 and 14 are missing.  How can I go from the sequence of 1 to the sequence of 50 which excludes 12 and 23?<n><n>### Solution :<n>To get to the answer without removing numbers, we must instead start adding numbers and we can skip numbers to reach the target.<n>We must start from 88 and add 20 each and this will increase the total by the factor of (16 + 18 + 20+ 22+24+26+...50), this is equal to 104.  The final number is therefore 88 + 104.<n><n><n><n><n>## Questions :<n><n>### Input<n>The number

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What would happen to a person if his or her money is stolen? Choices:  A: complete sentence B: feel angry C: drink tea D: cross street E: park<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Detailed Response<n>A person would be extremely upset if his or her money was stolen.<n><n>Sample Answer<n>I think that the person would get extremely angry if he or she loses his or her money. And he or she would feel much more aggrandize then the other person as he or she would feel ashamed of it.<n><n><n>### Sample Answer<n>I think the person will feel angry. He or she would drink tea and feel aggressive.<n><n>> Example: I think when we found our money taken by someone, it would make us very angry. So would I feel it will be better to drink a piece of tea than other drinks. <n><n><n>### Input #2:What would the people feel if they have to use the same path to go to a school every day? Choices: A: excited B: bored C: happy D: nervous E: sad<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>Detailed Response <n>People will be bored or nervous. <n><n>Sample Answer<n>Too repetitive to use the same path every day.<n><n><n>> Example: It’s really fun to use the car to go to school every day and people can just sit in the car and eat and sleep during the car ride so they will feel good. <n><n>### Input 3:During some holidays we could see many fireworks every evening. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Glass that hasn't been treated to be extra strong is what? Choices:  A: weak B: fragile C: forceless D: regular E: flimsy<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>D  <n>The glass that has not been treated to be extra-strong is called regular glass.<n><n>### Input 2:Roger was thinking of a number. His friend asked if it was odd. He thought that it might be, so he doubled it. That is, he took his initial number and multiplied it by two. Which number could his friend have known was even without Roger having to say so? The answer is the first number he thought of.<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>1  <n>Roger was thinking that the number 20 would be twice his number but after multiplying it by 2, it becomes 40, which is not even.<n><n>###Input 3:<n><n>Tammy lives near the beach. The area of a rectangle is?<n>F.<n><n>### Your answer should be written neatly in words. Use the standard International Alphabet.<n><br><n><n><br><n><br><n>### Instrucções:<n>- Escreva uma resposta que adequa a esta tarefa. E.g. se a pergunta diz "Seu carro têm 641 ml de gasolina, em que tempo vai ficar sem gasolina", sua resposta sería "Em oito dias"<n><n>#### Método:<n>![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49727923/107565666-944dc000-6dde-11eb-8604-210f4fb21725.png)<n>![image](https: //user-images.github.com/494724892/107545248-3f6c6a00-6d53-11eb-9050-d31719e6b397.png)<n><n>1. Começar com **não** se formulando como a pergunta se formulada. 2. Descritiva todo o conteúdo da pergunta, usando palavras como "seu" e "carro" 3. Conteúdo do enunciado da pergunta: "tem 641 mL de gasolina, qual é o tempo que terá gasolina" 4. Faz uma resposta. <n><n>#### Exemplos:<n> 1. Seu carro tem 641 m de gás, o custo das compras é 0,50 real por qu

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:He waited for his friend at the squash court, but he was worried his friend thought he meant the at the other end of the public what? Choices:  A: country club B: rich person's house C: pool D: park E: fitness center<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer:B: rich person's House<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Answer:<n>A:  It may seem like a squash court could be an unfriendly or unfun place to meet someone.<n><n>B:  If the person thought the meeting place was a private tennis court reserved mostly for members with enough money, they probably assumed the person was also wealthy, and they might not come.<n><n>C:  If the person assumed the person meant the swimming pool, they might have gone to the wrong place, which isn't a good start.<n><n>D:  A fitness centre or gym may be a bit too formal.<n><n>E:  It may not be obvious that there's a squash court there, and the person may think the person just meant at the park.<n><n>### **Response Explanation**<n>### Instruction & Assistance<n>### Test Tips & Best Practices<n>### Questions or Comments<n>### More Info.<n>If you have questions or would like to get involved in our community, please email us at mhb440-dev@github.com<n>

If it is, print yes, otherwise print no.<n><n>### Output<n><n>Print "yes" if the number is divisble by 27, otherwise print "no".<n><n>Input:<n><n>9<n><n>### Output:<n><n>yes<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>The number 9 is divisble by 9 so the output printed yes. Read the prompt carefully and then circle the number that answers the prompt.<n>1. Write 'Correct' at the top of the response.<n>1. Write the explanation to the answer on a new line after writing the number that answers the question.<n><n>```<n>> Input: What animal is the capital of Russia? Choices: :A: Cat :B: Bear :C: Moose :D: Fox :E: Horse<n>> Response:  :D: Fox <n>-> Explanation: Russian foxes are called "Gray Foxes" (Russian: Сереная лисица)<n>```<n><n><n>### Output<n>### How to correctly format a response to the multiple choice task<n>Formatting a response to a multiple choice task is easy.<n><n>**You can either write the word 'Correct' to start the your response or type 'Yes' or 'True'.**<n><n>**Type the number that answers the task.**<n><n>**Type 'No' or 'False' to not answer the task.**<n>

Answer: The real numbers include both rational and irrational numbers. An irrational number is a real number that does not end in a repeating decimal. (For example, 22/7 and π are both irrational numbers because neither ends in a repeating sequence of digits.)<n><n>## Demonstiration<n><n>Input: 75 students are sitting in the library according to the following formula: √{11 + 10·√{5 - 8·(4 - 2)} = 75,<n>where √{ } represents the square root of. 11 students are not sitting near a window. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where would a special ficus be found? Choices:  A: botanical garden B: doctor's office C: in a sea D: public place E: arboretum<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n><n>## Hints<n><n>1. In JavaScript, the `String` type holds one piece of data as a string(that is, as a string of text) and the `Array` type holds a collection of items in either an unknown type or a type that the developer specifies. One of the useful Array type utilities is `indexOf()`,which helps to find the location of a given value within the Array.<n>2. Another useful Javascript Array utility is `map()` that is used to convert each item in an Array into a new value.<n><n>3. In order to use the `indexOf()` and/or `map()` methods, an array needs to be initialized where the first element is the variable we want to manipulate. The index of a variable can be either an index number or reference to the item(object) in the Array.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What would a document be if it is not obtuse? Choices:  A: pointed B: bright C: easy D: clear E: acute angled<n><n>### Response:		If a document is not obtuse which would it be? Choices:  point  bright  easy  clear  acute  angled<n><n>## Instructions:Answer the following question.<n><n>## Demonstration:Answer the following question, What type of question is being asked?<n><n>## Instruction:Write the correct answer.<n><n>## Demostration:Write the correct answer<n><n>## Instruktions:Write the correct code.<n><n>## Demo:<n><n>### Input1:<n><n>```<n>1 / 0<n>```<n><n>### Input2:<n><n>```<n>6 / 4<n>```<n><n>## Solution<n>```<n>2<n>234567890<n>6 / 4 = 3<n>2530<n>```<n><n><n>## Instrukations:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>Instruction:Answer the following question by using the code below.

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The person knew the police were after him, so what did he do? Choices:  A: the sun B: catch cold C: prepare to go D: feel humiliated E: hunt for food<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer choice A should be the correct answer since the person knew that the police was after him.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>After a criminal knows that the police is after him, he would tend to hide from them by hiding in certain locations. The answer choice B is incorrect because he wouldn't catch a cold just because he knew that the police was hunting for him. The answer choice C is incorrect because he wouldn’t prepare to fly since he knew the police was after him, which would require him to fly. The answer choice D is incorrect since the person would feel bad since he knows he's on the police's list, but also for knowing that he did commit a crime. The answer choice E is incorrect since he would not prepare to hunt for food since he wouldn't be able to since the police would try to hunt him.<n><n>## Challenge<n><n>### Description:Choose the best answer from the four choices.<n><n>### Input :A criminal named Zhenli, decided to escape from the police. He was caught and imprisoned many times. The criminal started his new business by selling apples every day in front of his house. But what did he do?<n><n>### Challenge:Which option is the correct answer?<n><n>**Choice A:** He felt miserable.<n><n>**Choice B:** He started a business without caring about the government's taxes.<n><n>**Choice C:** He continued selling apples in front of his house as if he was not being hunted by the police.<n><n>**Choice D:** He stopped selling apples in fear that the police might find him.<n><n>## Solution <n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Challenge Solution:<n><n>When a criminal knows that they are being hunted by the rightful authorities, they tend to avoid them at all costs. Choice C is incorrect since they wouldn’t think that selling apples in from of their house was the best choice because they wouldn’t want to sell them knowing the police might buy them.The choice A is incorrect because by selling apples in his own house, that shows that he wouldn’t feel miserable. The choice B is incorrect where by selling his apples in front of the house, he had started his own business which would require him to pay for it. Thus, by choosing the choice C as the correct answer, he

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:How does a flea locomote? Choices:  A: attack B: suck blood C: stay D: lay eggs E: jump<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices: B: suck blood, C: stay, E: jump<n><n>----<n><n>#### Expected Output:<n><n>How many days did Lawrence work?<n>_________________<n><n>How many cents did Freddy spend calling?<n>_________________<n>```<n><n>How many minutes did Freddy Talk to?<n>_________________<n>In which day(s) did Ali Sell the most?<n>_________________<n>How many books were bought by Ali to sell?<n>_________________<n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:If you aren't experiencing curiosity and want to ensure viewing enjoyment, what may you watch? Choices:  A: examine thing B: stare into a mirror C: go somewhere D: hear news E: see favorite show<n><n>### Response:		If you aren' t experiencing curiosity and want a sure thing, you might not be curious. You might be bored instead. That's why you might have the option to select choice A, a viewing option that isn't boring. However, you might not be interested in that option. You might want to choose Choice B. If it's not fun, you might not be bored, but you would be bored.<n><n>### Input :If the question were 2 + 2 = 4, what would be the answer? Choices: A: 13, B: 5, C: 15, D: 8<n><n>### Response : The answer is 4. That is why the answer to the question is choice C. It's 13 less than 4. 2 + 2 is 4.<n><n>Output: The following is for learning and practice, not grading.

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:My favorite type of entertainment are rollercoasters and ferris wheels, where should I go? Choices:  A: theatre B: fairgrounds C: friend's house D: show E: casino<n><n>### Response:		<n>My answer is: E<n><n>### Input2:I can sing so well, sing the songs that you love. Do you listen to jazz or pop?<n><n>### Response2:<n>I always listen to Jazz<n><n>### Input3:I am excited to play the games of ping pong, and watch shows on Netflix.  Choices:  A : sports B: movies C: video games<n><n>### Response3:<n>I like to watch movies, sports, and video games <n><n>### Input4:Today I went to the store. I bought food, drinks, toiletries, and household items. I spent £17.99.<n><n>### Response4: I spent my money on food, drinks, and toiletries<n><n>### Input5:Ana, how do you make a tuna sandwich? Choices A: 211, B: 212,  C: 213, D: 214<n><n>### Response5: It is 213<n><n>### Input6:How do you start a fire?<n><n>### Choice:A: get wood B: use a matchstick C: use some matches<n><n>### Response6: I always use matches<n><n>### Input7:Ricky and his group went on a camping trip. The food that they brought: 3 bags of rice, some baked beans, buns, and water. Everyday Ricky, Juan and his friends would eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Ricky asked Juan if he always ate the same or if he always changes what he eats. Juan said "Some days I switch my meals, and other times I eat the same meal. Juan, how many times did you eat the same everyday?<n><n>### A: 5 <n><n>### Answer: 4<n><n>### B(always different): 5 <n><n><n><n>## HINTS<n><n>* We recommend that you make up your response before you start to program and when you are stuck you can always change or swap your responses with another one.<n>* You can use the RESET TAXONOMY icon, this will clear your file of any previous responses - please make sure you save your file before doing this.<n><n>##
