In other words, to find the length of a string, you will need to use a `GetLength()` method similar to what we used recently.<n><n>### Code<n><n>```<n>import java.util.Scanner;<n><n>public class BubbleSort<T> {<n>	// The function should be declared as public and static.<n>	public static void bubbleSorter<T>(T[] array) {<n>		for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {<n>			for (int j = i + 1; j < array.length; j++) {<n>		  	    if (array[i] > array[j]) {<n>		      /* Change the data. If this data is a string, use getLength.<n>		      (See code above for example.)*/<n>		      array[j] = array[i];<n>		      array [i] = array [j];<n><n>		      }<n>		    }<n>		}<n>		}<n>}<n>```<n>Here is an example that we'll sort an array of integers using this function<n>```<n>public static void main(String[] args) {<n>    Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);<n>    System.out.print("Enter an array: ");<n>    int[] array = scanner.nextInt(10

E: do well<n><n>### Response:		Choice C: hope for peaces in your day.<n><n>### Input :When a business was growing, they did some good things for the community. Which one did they do? Which one did they do after the good things they did? Choice A: paid for a kid's baseball team then sent some kids to campB: paid for a kid to go to school and buy him candy to eat<n>Choice D: paid for a kid’s school uniform and then bought him candy to eat with his friends<n>Choice E : sent a kid to school and gave him a uniform. And then they stopped doing good things and started making money<n><n>### Response :Choices a and b are good ones.<n><n>### Example:<n>Input: Alice is driving, while Brad is in the passenger seat. They leave Alice's house and 57 minutes later, they arrive at a mall 48.3 miles away. They then take a break in the car and 34 minutes after leaving the mall, they get to a restaurant nearby. The total distance they drive during the 3 hours they drive is 130.3 miles. How long was the break they took at the mall?<n>Answer: 30 minutes.<n><n>### Note:There is a wrong solution but it is wrong. The correct answer should have been one hour instead of 30 minutes. But this is a case of rounding. The answer is technically correct. So 30 minutes is a right answer.<n><n>### Solution:<n>The input said the time in total is 130 miles. So if we remove the 3 hours for the breaks, the time with is 127 miles. 130-127=3. So time taken in total is 3 hours. From the question it is quite clear that it is a three hour drive, so answer should be three hours. So the correct answer should have been three hours.<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:When we are thankful for getting something what do we do? Choices:  A: say thank B: smile C: looking for D: get more E: show appreciation<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: A<n>

How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Some might say that if you want to do something that results in changing society then you need to start from within, to do this what would you be doing? Choices:  A: riots B: vote C: change yourself D: social activism E: change clothes<n><n>### Response:		Demonstration: Change others by changing yourself: Be a good example if you want others to be kind. The problem you face can arise with what is inside you. That explains why you should always change your heart and mindset to do good to others. Becoming an activist will not do the work. You need to learn how to speak kindly and act right. If you don't know how to do this, learn how from the people around you who are already doing it.<n><n>### Input:"But if I love everyone, why can't other be my brother or sister in a family and not a stranger" Choices: A: If they have different color skin B: If I can't love them enough C: If everyone else loves each other D: If they were born with different parents E: If I don't know them<n><n>### Response:" I would understand it for all the reasons in choosing A, B, C, D and E respectively. The one where your family members are not strangers is 'If they were born with different parent and that make them brothers and sisters. However, I would say that I can also love someone that is different from me; maybe that is the reason he/she looks different from me, may be different culture or race of family or just different lifestyle. But I can still love him or her; just because he/she is different isn't any reason to stop loving or caring for them. I hope, in the eyes of some, they might even look at me as un-civilized because my heart can love them all equally regardless of their different race, social stand point and any lifestyles they may have"<n><n>### Input" I always feel it would be easy to have less of bad people in the country or the world, but then I think I would be the one becoming bad in order to control. (102 is subtracted from 4400)<n>Ali had 4398 unsold candies.<n><n>

Parents have their own responsibilities, and are also needed to make the necessary sacrifices for bringing up their child. Parents can guide children to become a good and loving human being. Children will also imitate the behavior of their parents.<n><n>### Input:#073870<n>The date is February 15, 1616. A man who later traveled to Alaska as an explorer was baptized in what town? Choices:  A: problems B: not noticeable C: deflation D: economic instability E: eat cake<n><n>### Response:		Inflation is a gradual increase in prices for goods and services in a country over time. If fighting inflation is not successful, it would cause economic instability.<n><n>### Inputs: Choose one thing from the list, which is less likely to be true when the economy is growing faster: <n><n>Choice 1: A: The demand for capital is increasing<n><n>Choice 2: B: More goods are being produced<n><n>Choice 3: C: Interest rates are falling<n><n>Choice 4: D: The government increases its spending<n><n>Choice 5: E: The GDP is not growing as fast as it was<n><n>### Response Choices: A,B,C or D<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that responds to the question and fully answers the question.<n>

There is 3 units per hour<n>### Your Response:<n>### Input: A: What's the name of the city in Canada that is known as the "Crossroad of America?"<n><n>### Our Answer:<n><n>### Input A:<n>How can I find x in y=3/4x+9?<n><n>### Solution:<n>A: y=3/4(x-2)=-1/2x<n><n>A:  ( 3/4x+4)(1/4x-1/2)=9<n><n>### Output:<n><n>A: If the x+y=9, x=-9/4, y=0;<n><n>A: x=5, y=1;<n><n>A: (3/4 x -3/4) (1/4 x + 1/4) = 9<n><n>A: x=-9/4<n><n>A: x = 5<n><n>### Input B:<n>How do you call the store if you want to order something?<n><n>### Our answer:<n>B: To order anything at the grocery store, you have to push the button on the intercom and tell the store owner what you want to buy. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Lilly owns the only kosher deli in the area.  She isn't in a heavily populated area.  Where might she live? Choices:  A: food court B: jerusalem C: new york city D: jewish community E: town<n><n>### Response:		<n>A). If there are few kosher shops, then it could only be on an area with smaller population.<n><n>Another example is, If there are few McDonald's, then it could only belong to a less populated area.<n><n>### Input :<n>John buys pizza from two stores. He buys 12 pizzas from Bob's Pizza. He also buys 8 pizzas from Lila's Pizza. If Bob's Pizza and Lila's Pizzeria have the same sales price for pizza, how much money did John spend on pizza? Choices: A. 96B. 64C. 100D. 160E. 32<n><n>### Answer:<n>You could solve with the difference of pizza sold from these two stores.<n>Let's say A and B represent these two stores.<n><n>John buys 8 pizza from A and 12 pizza from B.<n>Since A and B have the same prices, John will be charged 8 * B + 12 * A<n>$ A = $12<n>$ B = $8<n><n>Therefore John will be charged $96<n><n>### Input<n><n>The sum of the first 10 consecutive even numbers is 102.  What is the smallest even number? Choices: A: 100B: 102C: 104D: 200E: 1000<n><n>## Result<n><n>The smallest even is 100<n><n>## Input<n><n>If 2x and 7y are parallel, what is the value of xy?<n><n>A. 7<n>B. 2<n>C. -7<n>D. -2<n>E. 10<n><n><n>## Solution<n><n>We know that 2x is perpendicular to 7y. We then have,<n><n>$2x \cdot -7y + 7y \cdot -2x = 0$<n>which is equivalent to $4x - 49 = 0$<n><n>We then have,<n><n>$-49 = -49x \Rightarrow x = \frac{49}{-1}$ = $10 $<n><n>Because of the signs, the two vectors are opposite

Choices:  A: smile B: singing C: sweat D: act E: dance<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```javascript<n>const answerToTheQuestion = (question) =>{<n>    if(question===A){<n>        console.log("smiling")<n>    }<n>    else if(question===B){<n>        console.console.log("singing")<n>    }<n>else if(question===C) {<n>    console.log("sweating")<n>}  else if(question===D){<n>    console.log('dancing')<n>}<n>     else if(question===E) {<n><n>        console.log('acting')<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n><n>### Answer:<n><n>```javascript <n>const answerToTheQuestions = (question) => {<n>    if (question===A) {<n>        console.log(24)<n>    }<n>    if (question === B) {<n>        console_log(20)<n>    }<n>if (question === C) {<n>    console_log(30)<n>} else if (question === D) {<n>console.log(50)<n>}<n>else if (question === E) {<n>console.console.log(150)<n>} else (question == F) { }<n>}<n>```

How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:His day at the office was nearing an end, he went to the start menu on his computer to do what? Choices:  A: run programs B: play games C: control model D: power down E: reason exists<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input:<n>He went to the start menu to power down the computer and reason exists.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Every day in the office he does these things: Bread in the morning, check emails, meetings, calls, reports and reasons. He knows that the computer could be in safe mode<n>but he did not do this as he needs to reason a way out of his busy day.

How did she know which tires were flat?<n><n>### Response A: If the car was on an elevated surface, there would be no way to find out she had two flat tires. If the car was on flat surface then she might be able to tell which tires were flat because those that were flat would be leaning farther or more in different directions than the others.<n>

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where could you find some airplanes that are not being used? Choices:  A: war B: aircraft carrier C: sky D: graveyard E: crash<n><n>### Response:		What if you couldn't find where you could find any airplanes that are being used? Choices A: war B: Aircraft C: Sky D: graveyard<n>E: Crash<n><n>### Input2:What is the area of a rectangle? Choices: <n>Answer:A: 48 sq. metres<n>B: 77 sq. metres<n>C: 49 sq.metres<n>D: 60 sq.metres<n>E: 157 sq.metres <n>### Response: <n> <n> <n>> Please add the file "instruction.png".<n><n>### Feature 1: <n><n>The question could be a short explanation of the topic which includes a list of choices (multiple select question) or a question with different choice ( single select )<n><n>### Features 2: <n>```<n>- Answer<n>```<n><n>### Feedback 1: <n>- We do feedback in order to make sure that the answer is correct. <n><n>### Guidelines 1:<n>```<n>- Guidelines: We make guidelines in order to let the team members not to make mistakes. <n>```<n><n>## Additional Information <n>- Please do not remove any of the questions or answer parts, as this will require us to spend more time checking the answers.<n>- When selecting a language, please make sure your answers can be understood by all participants.<n><n>## Next steps<n><n>To learn more about creating tasks, see [**here**](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkId=178933).<n><n><n>

Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where does a beaver leave? Choices:  A: wooded area B: body of water C: the ocean D: british columbia E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question.<n><n>## Solution (Python)<n><n>import time<n>print("Input:")<n>while True:<n>    inp = input()<n>    try:<n>        if inp == "Tapanga and Corey":<n>            answer = 29<n><n>            time.sleep(3)<n><n>            print("Demonstration:")<n>            print("Input:")<n>            while True:<n>                inp = input() <n>                time.sleep(3 ** len(inp))<n><n>                if "New Year's Eve" in inp:<n>                    print("answer:")<n>                    time.sleep(3 + 3 ** len("local calls cost 5 c " in inp))<n><n>                    answer = 10<n>                    break<n>                if "in the same" in inp:                                    <n>                    print("Demonstrtaion answer:")<n>                    answer = len(inp)<n>                    break<n><n>            print("answer:")   <n><n>        if inp.isdigit():<n>            answer = int(inp)<n>            print("Incorrect input:")<n>            print(f'\tInputs: Tapanga and C or E' )<n>        if inp =="Where does":<n>            break<n>        else:<n>            print("input not found!")<n>    except BaseException as e:<n>      print("invalid input")<n>        raise e<n><n>input = input ()<n>print (input)<n>           <n>                        <n>                   <n>                <n>

For example, if you wanted to investigate what kind of video games teenagers play, you could use instrumental variables to see if they are indeed associated with lower test scores.<n><n>To do this, you need to compare the test scores of 8-year-old children who were 8 years old to now, as if they were still 8-year-olds, while controlling for current ages of the 8-year-ole subjects.

Choices:  A: panic B: getting in trouble C: mass hysteria D: go to prison E: murder<n><n>### Response:		Panic - Rumors can lead to panic, but that depends on how people perceive what they hear from others. A panic attack is a type of anxiety attack in which your body becomes overwhelmed by emotions. If people believe rumors and become overly concerned about monsters or something they perceive to be negative like murder for example, then their reaction will be to panic.<n><n>### Input:"A good teacher is someone you remember." What is in the quote that is important? ___<n><n>### Response:"A good teacher is..." _____ - This quote talks about important attributes like learning and knowledge and it's about how a teacher is perceived. Teachers shape future leaders and they teach people how to learn and how to apply knowledge to our everyday lives.<n><n>### Examples for Choice B<n><n>* A:  A,  B: A,  C:  A and B,  D: A and B,  E:  E<n><n>### Example 1 for Choice A<n><n>* A: A:  Panic B: A: getting in trouble C A: Mass hysteria D: Panic<n><n>### Example for Choice B<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. Demonstration:Answer the multiple choice questions.<n><n>### The test is named after the mathematician, computer scientist, and pioneer in the field of theoretic computer science.<n>### He was a pioneer in the branch of cryptography, which has important implications on the implementation of security protocols.<n>### The goal of a test is to determine the extent to which a candidate has an understanding and acceptance of a concept.<n>###  How many points are the following numbers? Choices  Eight F: Thirty-three C: Four F: Two D: One D: Three H: Six H: Fourteen G: Six H: Four H: Fifty<n><n>---<n><n>## The Turing test evaluates whether computers have the ability to mimic human intelligence.<n>## Its name is after mathematician Alan Turing.<n>## He is known for cracking the Enigma Code in World War II.<n>## In the test, the "human" is placed in front of a computer terminal.<n>## Conversating with another party about a variety of subjects.<n>## After a few minutes, the "human" will determine if the computer is human.<n>## The computer may or may not be human.<n><n>---<n><n>#### The Turing test is intended,

Choices: **A:** cupboard _ B:** coffee _ C:** candy bar _ D:** soda pop _<n><n>answer: _coffee_

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The wood became fossilized, what did the paleontologists call it when they found ti? Choices:  A: sanded B: composted C: warp D: hardened E: petrify<n><n>### Response:		<n>- 1. A<n>- 2. B<n>- 3. C<n>- 4. D<n>- 5. E<n><n>### Answer: <n>- 690<n>- 53<n>- 9<n>- 350<n>- 940<n><n>### Explanation:<n>> How many hours would Lawrence Work:<n>> <n>> Let 𝑛= total hours<n>> <n>> Monday+firday=(8 +5)=13<n>> Tuesday+friday=(5.5 + 5) =10.5<n>> Wednesday+thursday=(5.5 +5.5)=11<n>> Total=13+10.5+11=35<n>> Now 𝑛𝑛=35<n>> 35=𝑛😱

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The banjo finds it's history in the Caribbean, but it's probably most famous where? Choices:  A: music shop B: music store C: jug band D: united states E: among nice people<n><n>### Response:		<n>```Python<n>import random<n>sounds = ["Cats","Rats","Through","Through","The",<n>           "Thrill"]<n><n>def rand_word(sounds):<n>    return random.choice(sounds)<n><n>def rand_song(rand_word):<n>    return f"{rand_word} - {rand_word}"<n><n><n>def get_history():<n>    ans = []<n>    for i in range(0, 5):<n>        ans.append(i + 1)<n>    return ans<n><n><n>def rand_phrase(history):<n>    list_of_words = list(history)<n>    word_list = list_of_words[1:4]<n>    ans = rand_word(word_list)<n>    return rand_song(ans)<n>```<n><n>### Demostration:<n>```Python<n>history = get_history()<n>while True:<n>    print(rand_phrase(history))<n>```<n>or<n>```Python<n>ans_history = rand_phrase(get_history())<n>for rand_song in ans_history:<n>    print(f"{rand_song} - {rand_words}")<n>```<n>

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. It didn't matter.   He didn't heave anything to put it on, and he lacked the what to balance it? Choices:  A: tenacity B: hands C: coaster D: skill E: breaking<n><n>### Response:		In the sentence man doesn't have a what to balance the cup on the table, he lacks: <n><n>1. tenacity: to make your mind determined to do something or achieve something<n><n>1. hands: the top part of a person’s body that is between the shoulder and the wrist and that contains the fingers<n><n>1. coaster: something or somebody that stops something: <n><n>11. skill: the natural ability to do something<n><n>### Input :You can't have some oranges and some apples at the same time.   If a person has a fruit and a half, they have some and a half. But, if a person is out of all the fruits, they don't have some because they are out of all of them. They lack: A: some apples B: some oranges C: some of something D: some fruit E: none<n><n>### Response :In the sentence "You can't do some oranges and some oranges at the same time", if someone has some apples. He/she have : <n><n>1. some and a half : (1/2 of some=some/2=some/2/2=1/2=some apples)<n><n><n>### Input  : 10 pencils<n><n>### Response  : How many are left?<n><n>### Input   :<n>- We ate everything. Some of the oldest known examples survive today. Inkwells are generally divided into four main groups: medieval, Renaissance, late Renaissance and Victorian.<n><n>### Input What is the best description of a fountain pen in everyday use? Choices A: uses refillable ink reservoir B: uses disposable ink cartridge C: has a retractable nib D: has a retractible bladder<n><n>### Response<n>Answer: C.If you do not want to buy a new disposable one every time, choose a refillable cartridge to save  money on ink or reusable cartridges. Refillable pens take the cost of disposable pens which come with one-time cartridges.<n><n>### What was T.S. Eliot's job in 1929? Choices: A: a librarian B: an accountant C: an editor D: an engineer E: a salesman<n><n>### Response Answer: Librarian.In 1927, Eliot became an assistant editor at the publishing house Faber & Gwyer. He worked 504 days a year to collect information from different people and made articles.<n><n>### In 1929, Eliot was appointed editor of the Criterion literary magazine.<n><n>### How do many people describe the smell of cigarette smoke? Choices: A : sweet and spicy B: delicious C: stinky D: like pizza E: earthy<n><n>### Response The most common answer is "like tobacco".Cigarette smoke has a  characteristic smell - it is not fresh nor clean, but sometimes even earthy. This is because cigarette smoke consists of many different gases and chemicals.<n><n>### The most common way to describe the smell of cannabis? A: like mold and fish B: like fruits C: like stagnant water D: like burnt wood E: like flowers<n><n>### Response C.Cannabis is one of the most distinctive smells due to the presence of a variety of terpenes.Cannabis smells like burnt sugar, citrus, pine

Choices:  A: backyard B: restaurant C: crockpot D: neighbor's house E: barbeque<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct response is: "barbeque"<n><n>### Explanation:A backyard is where you cook in your own yard. A restaurant is a place you eat. A restaurant you do not cook, and you may not be cooking in the backyard, either. A neighbor's house is not something you go to. A crockpot is not something you cook in, and you may not even have one in your backyard.<n><n>### Examples:<n>For answers to the problems see examples on this [page](../../examples/partners/122-2019-12-06_-task-1)<n><n>### Assessment:Mark the appropriate letter from a to f next to the question or problem that each response correctly answers.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Sean was lying about the body, but he was very scared.  He constantly worried about what? Choices:  A: the reward money B: hurt feelings C: being found out D: problems E: trouble<n><n>### Response:		The correct response is "The reward money".<n><n>#### Rationale<n><n>If the question were about hurt feelings, problems or trouble then Sean would not have been lying. The question is asking about Sean's scaredness.<n><n>If the question was about Sean's worries about being found out, then hurt feelings, problems/trouble and being found out is what he was worried about. The question is asking what specific part of the body Sean was worried about.<n><n>If the person did not read the question carefully, then they would assume that being worried about what part of the body Seen could not lie about.<n><n>#### Improper Responses:<n><n>### Response 0.1:A<n><n>#### Rationale:<n><n>If this response was the answer to this question then that would mean that Sean had lied and hurt someone's feelings. Sean says that he lied. This response would be incorrect, as he did not lie about someone's feelings.<n><n>### Response0.2:<n><n>#### Rationale :<n><n>If this response were the answer to this question than that means that Sean was lying, but that doesn't make any sense. Sean's body was being found.<n><n>### Example: Response:0.3<n>#### Rationale : <n><n>Response 0.3 doesn't fit. Even though it seems a good answer, it doesn't really make sense.<n><n>### Improper Response: Response: 0.4<n><n>#### Rationale  :<n><n>Response 0 wouldn't fit because if that was the correct response, than Sean wouldn't have been worried about the body being found. He probably would've been more worried about someone finding out that he lied and about hurting someone's feelings. <n><n>#### Rationale B:<n><n>Response 1 wouldn't really fit either. This is response 0.4.<n><n>### Responses 0.5 and 0.6:<n><n>The responses 0.5 and0.6 are not really responses but are distractors.<n><n>#### Rationale A:<n><n>The body doesn't have to be there. Just like 0.5 distracts from the actual answer is 0.6 is also a distractor. The body is lying
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Joe suffered many consequences from stabbing a stranger to death.   Among them, the family of the victim did something to him. What was that? Choices:  A: knife wounds B: buy a gun C: bleeding D: jail time E: law suit<n><n>### Response:		The response that best completes the task will be one of your program's main functions.   The response should be one that runs a for loop over input variable "i" by setting local variable "j" to input variable i, and printing the output variable "x", to the screen, and then updating x to a value that it was previous, and ending the for loop after the current value has been re-set.<n><n>### Input : The for loop should begin with a for j = 1:20<n><n>### Testing: In place of the variable "i" type the input "i=50"<n><n>### Program's Functioning: The for loop should create a for loop in the program such that "j" increases from one value to another as the program runs. This will display the multiplication of the "j" variable by the "i" variable.<n><n>### Test to Ensure Program is functioning properly: To make sure the program is working properly, run the program and the console should display 50 * 50.<n><n>### Program: Coded Solution:<n><n>```python<n>x = 0<n>for j in range(1,20):<n>x = x * j<n>j = 1<n>```<n><n>### Output<n><n>Example output:<n><pre>.<n><n>1<n>.<n><n>1<n><n>2<n><n>4<n><n>8<n><n>16<n><n>32<n><n>64<n><n>128<n>...<n><n></pre><n>

The response should be the total number of times.<n><n>When answering the question, you should complete the task, not provide a simple answer to the question. For example, answer how many books are not sould, not say that total = 220.<n><n>### Output:<n>> **"Tapanga has 68 candies in total."**<n><n>### Demystification:<n>The solution above is correct. The question is asking us to determine the number of books after Ali sold them. We do this by working backwards through the number that Ali initially had (600) and through the number he sold (66).<n>Ali ended up with 64. Now, if we subtract the number he sold (84), we have the number of remaining books: 206.<n><n>**Answer 1:** "Input: Ali had a book of 800. He sold 67 on Monday, 12 on Tuesday, and 22 on Wednesday. Choices:  A: hole B: television C: sporting goods store D: pool table E: sporting event<n><n>### Response:		If you were to play a game of pool, you would likely see people in uniform playing the game on a pool table because the ball would move from billiard to billiard. But, in the context of multiple choice question A, the answer is Hole B. What I'm getting at is that when you're a cue sport, the game is played in the hole, but the ball is played in a different place because you aren't throwing the ball in the hole.<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:There weren't potatoes but actually a snake in his what? Choices:  A: burlap sack B: hot country C: purse D: pet shops E: deep grass<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input 2: There were 445,958,286 Americans alive in 2011, but 470,000 Americans died that year. If there were 720000113 Americans alive in 2101, how many Americans died in 2102?<n><n>### Response 2: D<n><n>### Input : There are 46 boys and 76 girls in the class how many of total are boys or girls:<n><n>### Response : 46-76 = 30 20-30 = 10<n><n>###Input There are 80 people in a class, all standing on one line. 30 of them smile, 98 of them are girls and 50 of them are taller than their teacher. How many are boys?<n><n>###Response 95<n><n>###Input A boy bought a book for $6.80 with 53 cents sales tax.He paid it with a 2 dollar bill and a 12 dollar bill.How much was left in change?<n><n>###Comment <n>#####First write numbers(6.80) then write answer(1.60)<n><n>#####then write 6.80, -2, 0.00, 3, 4 96.<n><n>###Response B<n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The people in class were instructed to brainstorm ideas, how would they use their minds for this? Choices:  A: shake hands B: control events C: talk to each other D: think creatively E: dress themselves<n><n>### Response:		<n>E: All the choices seem correct but the answer is E.<n><n>    ##<n>    # You can edit and run this file from the accompanying project window (Debug -> Start Without Debugging) or the console<n>    #<n>    # To run the sample at compile time, call<n>    #     scala Sample.scala<n>    # from the command line.<n>    #<n>    import scala.util._<n><n>    class Solution {<n>        def solve (m: Map[Int, Int]) (op: Int => Int) (pred: Int => Int): Boolean = {<n>            var sum = 0;<n>            def add (v: Option[Int]) = if (v.exists (x=>op(x)).orTrue(sum)) sum else sum+x;<n><n>            if (m.isEmpty) {<n>                m.foldLeft (add (m.values map (_.toOption)))((acc,x) => add(acc orTrue x))<n>            } else {<n>                m.values.foreach { x =><n>                    val i = x.toInt<n>                    x match {<n>                        case v if i =>!isEven(pred(v)) => acc // 1<n>                        case v => acc // 0<n>                    }<n>                }<n>            }<n><n>            sum<n>        }<n><n><n>        def isEven (n: Int): Boolean = n.toLong.modulo(2) == 0<n><n>        def isDivisible (n: Int, d: Int): Boolean = {while (n > 0) (if (n % d == 0) true, n/=d,false) }<n><n><n>        // Answer<n>        def sum (ops: Seq[Int => Int]) (pred: Int => Boolean):Int = {<n>            val m = ops groupBy (_.toInt(_).isDivisible(5))<n>            val sum = m.values groupBy ((v: Map[Int,Int])+_).maxBy (_._2 + 1).values.sum<n><n>            val sumEven = isEven sum + sum.values map (_.sum)<n>            val sumEvens = isEven sumEven + sumEven.values map (_.isEven)<n>            var sumDoubles = false<n>            if (sumDoubles

They switch after each game. A player who picks the same rule twice will get 1 point while the other player will get 5 points. If the players tie at any point the tie is worth 10 points. If one player is at 25 or more points, they gain 5 points for each point they are above 25, but if the player is below 25, they will lose 5 points, while the other player gains points at the same rate. The player with the most points when they play the 8th game is the winner. How many points does the first player need to win after the eight games?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### input: 415 - 276<n>answer = 139<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demostration :<n><n><p>Megan goes to the store to purchase a pound of rice. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What will you need to do to decide whether to be seeing artifacts? Choices:  A: learning B: painful memories C: thinking D: awe inspiring E: pleasure<n><n>### Response:		<n>I will need to do all of the below:<n>1. Learning<n>2. Painful memories<n>3. Thinking<n>4. Awe, Inspiring<n>5. Pleasure<n><n>### Input<n>1. The city zoo is a huge building in the city of Xian. Every day, a thousand visitors enter a hall in the center of the zoo building. A thousand people enter the same room every day. When they do so, the room is full. 2. They enter the hall exactly one-third of an hour after the previous thousand people left the hall. 3. The people who leave the hall are allowed to stay in the zoo only for another 3 hours. After that, they must leave the zoo. Then new visitors will enter the hall. 4. Each person is free to stay as long as he wants after he leaves the hall. For each hour after the first 3 hours he stays in the zoo, the visitors pay 10 yuen. 5. Visitors must pay before the leave the zoo after leaving the hall. They pay only once.

Choices:  A: fire B: belong to C: winter storm D: face south E: burn down<n><n>### Response:		He was scared due to the smoke detector alarm.<n><n>Input:John spent all summer reading great comic books with his friend Rory. He spent 5 days each on the books 'Doctor Strange' and 'Invincible Iron Man'. He read 3 days each on the books "The Amazing Spider-Man" and "Astonishing X-Men'. How many comic books did he not read?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>#### Instruction:<n>This problem can be solved using simple addition.<n><n>First, we subtract the number of days John didn't read any books (9), from the total number of comic books he read (13). By doing this, John would be left with 4 books that he didn't read.<n><n>### Input<n>We are told that, if we subtract the number of the days John didn't care about any books (9), then John would be left with four books he didn't read (13 - 9 = 4). The key here is what information is needed to answer the question in this example. This allows John to know how many days he read each book and what books he didn't have.<n><n>**Instruction**: The instruction says to solve this problem by subtracting the number of days John spent reading comic books from the total number of days that John read comic books.<n><n>The instruction says to subtract the number of days that John _read_ comic books by the number of days that he read comic books, making this easier to comprehend. This problem is in a format that allows it to be quickly solved.<n><n>### Response<n>The way we approach these questions is with an instruction, then an equation to follow up with. The response is also in the format of equations.<n><n>The answer we gave to the instructor is "The answer is 4".<n><n>Input: What can you do when you see a math question like this? He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:The lady was getting worked up about the article explaining the uptick in accidents in their area, but her husband was dismissive of it stating that accidents what? Choices:  A: happen to people B: hurt people C: happen anytime D: happen often E: happen anywhere<n><n>### Response:		Accidents happen anytime<n><n>### Explanation:The correct answer is Accidents happen anytime.<n><n>Input: The lady was getting worked up (upset) about the article explaining the recent increase in accidents in their town. However, her husband was dismissive (thoughtless) of it, telling her that accidents: Choice:1) happen to people 2) hurt people 3) happen anytime 4) often - happens or 5) hurt people<n><n>### Response1: Accidents happen to people answer: C<n><n>### Response2: Accidents hurt people answer: D<n><n>### Response3: Accidents happen any time answer: B<n><n>### Response4: Accidents happen often answer: E<n><n>### Response5: Accidents often happen answer: D<n><n># Task List:<n><details><n><summary>To make this feature easier to understand, copy the instructions below and paste them into an answer box somewhere on the website and press submit. That's all you have to do!</summary><n><n>Copy the task below and paste it into an answer box and provide your response.<n>- [ ] This task is:<n><n>- [ ] The task description is:<n><n>- <n><n>- The correct response is:<n><n>- My response is:<n><n></details>

The code will appear in parentheses after the job title. Some names are associated only with their job titles such as "Manager."<n><n>* You will see that for many of the titles (a majority?) there are two to five numbers after the title (for example: "Account Specialist" is followed by 3 different salaries). These numbers refer to the person's pay grade. Each person is paid a grade that may be different from the other employees of the same title or job. Each salary is given in U.S. dollars, and all money is in U.S. cash, not cheques. Your job is to find the employee with the lowest salary for each of the ten different jobs listed and write their names in the blanks below.<n><n>* Write the employee's full name in the appropriate place. If you find more than one employee with the lowest salaries for a title, choose one from the pair. <n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input:<n><n>```text<n>Employee Job Title Salary Manager Account Specialist 40  (3)  Account Specialist 45  (2)  Account Specialist	40  (2)<n>Assistant 20  (2)   Assistant 25  (3)   Assistant 30  (2)  Assistant 45	(3)  Manager<n>Account Specialist 30  (1)   Account Specialist 35  (1)  Account Specialist    (1)  Accountant<n>Accountant     (1)    Accountant    (1)    Account Executive  (1)    Sales Manager<n>Account Executive  (1)   Clerical    (1)   Custodian  (1)

Choices:  A: supermarket B: motel C: at hotel D: shampoo bottle E: hair salon<n><n>### Response:		The hair salon<n><n><n>### Instructions:Answer each of the following questions.<n><n>### Which of the three children below is the youngest?<n><n>Choices: 1-C 2-A 3-B 4-D<n><n>### The three children are identical twins. Which one is the oldest?<n><n>Choices<n>22-A<n>11-D<n>9-B<n>20-C<n><n>### Which one is heavier than the other two?<n><n>Choices 1-C 5-A 3-D 4-B<n><n>### Complete each of the following math expressions.<n><n>Choices: _x/15_, x/25_, -/15_, -/25_<n>### How many times bigger is the biggest number than the smallest number?<n><n>Choices __2__, __5__, __7__, __10__, __15__<n><n>### Choices: 9/5, 5/3, 4/2<n><n>### Two students are running a race. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:James didn't know what to do.  He felt that he'd ruin his relationship with Jen if he took it further, and he didn't want to do that.  At the same time,  He fight that pushing farther might do what to something good? Choices:  A: found B: destroy C: construct D: fix E: produce<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer:<n><n>E<n><n>### Explain:<n><n>A) "pushing farther might do what to what (something good)" is grammatically incorrect. (pushing farther might do something good?)<n><n>B) "pushing farther does what good" is grammatically incorrect.<n><n>C) "pushing farther destroyed something good" is incorrect grammatical structure.<n><n>D) "pushing farther built something good" is grammatically correct.<n><n>E) "pushing farther produced something good" is gramatically correct.<n><n><n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>1.<n>A) "pushed what (might/further) what (good)" is grammatically incorrect syntax. <n>"might" is a linking word (sometimes known as an adverbial modifier), in that it modifies the sentence it is connected to. The sentence could more properly be rewritten as follows:<n>* "Might pushed something good (further)??"<n>* "I wonder what will (might) happen if I push further??"<n>* "I don't know (could) what might happen if I push good things further??"<n>* etc.<n><n>2.<n>B) "pushed what further did good/???" is a grammatically incorrect sentence construction. <n>Again, "further" is a modifier, and "did" cannot be used in this way.<n><n>3.<n>C) "pushed what did farther/good?" is grammatically incorrect. <n>Again: the first verb has completed it's job, whereas the second verb is currently being done. The sentence should be revised as follows:<n><n>* "pushed what (did) did I do (good)??"<n><n>4.<n>D) "push what more/good?" is gramatically incorrect sentence formation. <n>Again the sentence formation should be revised.<n><n>5.<n>E) "push what more good?" <n>

Choices:  A: see king B: hello C: meow D: drink water E: live many years<n><n>### Response:		<n>*A: mew and see king*<n><n>You can also use this code to create the test and it will give you the correct answers in the end..<n><n>```powershell<n>function get-psversion<n>{<n>    [CmdletBinding()]<n>    param()<n><n>    Write-Host "The Powershell version is" $PSVersionTable<n>    Write-Host ""<n>    return ""<n>}<n><n>function get-correctanswers<n>{<n><n>    $catanswers=@("A: meow" "C: meow" "E: meow")<n>    $doganswers=@("B: hello" "E: hi")<n>    $cowanswers=@("D: moo" "E: moo")<n>    $duckanswers=@("C: quack" "E: quack")<n><n>    $answers="A: $($doganswers)"<n><n>    $ans="$answers  $($doganswers)<>"<n><n>    return $ans<n><n>}<n>```<n><br/><n><n># Test the program <-- For all answers

What is the sum of the digits of n if the digits are added from left to right?<n>The digits in a number can be multiplied (e.g. multiply 3 by 4, 3 times 4 is 12). What is the product of the digits if the digits are multiplied from left to right?  <n>To subtract an integer, we can take the smaller one and add 48. For example, to subtract 7 from 17 you can take 7 and add 48 and you get 55 (5 + 5 = 10).<n>What is the quotient of dividing an integer by 2? The quotient is the same as the rest after dividing 2 (the result after subtracting the first integer from the second).<n>Can you derive the other rules from this one?<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where is a monkey likely to be found in the rainforest? Choices:  A: tree tops B: rain forest C: zoological gardens D: great outdoors E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Detailed Answer:<n><n>Dear Mathy,<n><n>Thanks for your question.<n><n>Your answer has a few typos, but I've cleaned up your letter to include those details.<n>To answer your question about the Rainforest, the monkey would definitely not be found in a zoo. Why? Well, the rainforest is where most monkeys live. You can also look up the types of monkeys that live above a jungle/rainforest.<n><n>Let me know if you have any other questions!<n><n>Sincerely,<n><n>Mathy<n><n>The above submission was written a a third grader named "Mathy", an imaginary character, but the letter is very similar to many other letters we receive.<n><n>The letters are generally quite short and the "question" is very brief. The "multiple choice answers" are all wrong.<n><n>The questions have no relation with the actual questions.<n><n>For instance in Mathy's request it asks you about the monkeys in the rainforest, however the questions has to do nothing to do with the jungle.<n><n>In some ways it's not so helpful, but in some ways it's a great way to get students to be more engaged, to be active readers, and to think outside the box (in a way).<n><n>### Delivery Method:<n><n>The Delivery Method will be the submission form for an online form builder.<n><n>It's recommended you use MailChimp if you're trying to send out emails to people. They have an embedded form builder you can use, that makes it simple to embed the submission form.<n><n>### Form Structure:<n><n>The form should start with a couple of fields for submission to the parent. If this is a form that should only be taken by people you know, this may not be necessary, but this is still recommended as a best practice.<n><n>After that the form should probably include 4 fields.<n><n>1. Instruction. This is where you can include the instructions with the task.<n>2. Question. This is where the actual question or request can be made. This should follow the format of something similar to "Below is an instruction that describes <something>".<n>3. Response. This is where you get the response to the request or question. Below is an instruction that describes a task. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What does reckless driving lead to on a person? Choices:  A: injuries B: fatigue C: traffic jams D: tired E: accidents<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: injuries<n><n>#### Why did you choose?<n>Due to what the instructions says "Due to reckless driving, a person will suffer injuries. But the person might get tired, traffic jammed, and might have accidents too." so that's why I choose A: injuries.<n><n>---<n>

Some questions involve the  use of the if statement.<n><n>### Answer The following questions involve the use of a nested- if statement. If true, the statements in the nested if statement are evaluated.<n>You need to determine whether or not the question is asking for an if statement or a nested if statement using your new commands.<n><n>## Examples:<n>**Nested if statement(if a if b):**<n>If true: statement 1. statement 2<n>Else: statement 1. else statement 2<n><n>**Conditional statement (if a):**<n>If: statement 1<n>Else: statement 2<n><n>### Input<n>Input: The farmer counts 47 chickens. Choices:  A: rain forest B: tree tops C: toy store D: zoological gardens E: great outdoors<n><n>### Response:		If the place is a capture, it is either A or B. If the place is a toy store or a great outdoors, it is either C or D. The only choice that includes both the word toy and the word capture are A and C. To exclude those two options, we can say that the answers can't both contain the letter O. And the only choice that doesn't have the word toy is D.<n><n>### Solution: A,B,C,D<n><n>Given the input "a. Monkey" I want to add a condition where the first four letters a monkey have a value of 1 and the last three letters have a value of 5. The solution is the word "Monkey."<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input 1<n>:Input 2<n><n>### Solution

How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Where would people be looking at some things which can move, but are not moving? Choices:  A: football stadium B: surface of earth C: car show D: opera E: movie<n><n>### Response:		<n>### A: football stadium<n>People at a football stadium watches the games or are going to buy something from the stadium. I know people aren't moving because why would they if they aren't playing sports for any reason. The only way they would move is if they are being escorted off of the field or something because of a violation. The only way that they are moving is on the sideline. And I highly doubt that they are moving in order to play, they are just there to watch or being told to watch, etc.<n><n>A: A-Football stadium is where people are looking at some things that can move but are not moving.<n><n>### B: surface of earth<n>B: Surface of earth because why would they be looking something that is not moving. I know this is weird because on earth, nothing is moving because all movements on earth are caused by gravity. All movements are caused by the earth, the moon and the sun. So for example, how could someone be moving unless they have been to the surface of the moon or have been to outer space like me. Also, if they were looking at the surface of earth, why would they be looking at it? And how could they be moving, nothing is at their house unless their looking at their house. They could be looking at their house, which it would be impossible for them to move from their house to their house because, I know that it isn't. The only thing I can think of is to be moving around to view their house, which it wouldn't make sense because they already have 360 degree view of their house already.<n><n>### C: car show<n>C: Car show because people goes to car show to look at the cars.<n><n>### D: opera<n>D: Opera because they can be looking through a camera or something they already have a 360 degree of what is going on.<n><n>### E: movie<n>E: Movie because people have the technology of being able to see the whole movie in HD, at any angle. People don't move because there nothing is physically stopping them from looking at something, in their perspective.<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What creatures performing pollination are loved my millions? Choices:  A: birds B: action C: butterflies D: happiness E: anxiety<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: Action<n><n>### Instructions:<n>What are the given choices of the question, explain the answer and responds.<n><n>### Code:<n>What are the possible choices to the question: What creatures performing pollinations are love my millions?<n><n>### Instuction:Write a response that appropriately complete the request.<n><n>What are the possible answers to the question: What type of creature performs pollinations?<n><n>```python<n>answer = ["birds","butterfaies","action","happiness","anxiety"]<n>```<n><n>### Answer<n>What are the possible responses to the choices: "birds","butterflies","action","happines","anxiety".<n><n>### Choices:<n>1. **answer = ["birds"]**, the answer is "birds"<n>2. **answer = ["butterflies"]**, the answer of 5.5 hours per day is "butterfly's"<n>3. **answer = ["action"]**,the answer is "action".<n>4. **answer = ["happiness"]**, the answer that the pollenators are happy.<n>5. **answer = ["anxiety"]**, the answer on which creature is anxious?<n><n>### Response<n>What is the response of the possible answers?<n><n>```python <n>result = [1,2,3,4,5]<n>```<n><n>## Challenge:<n><n>Which of the following choices did the answer go by?<n><n>1. birds<n>1. butterflys<n>1. action<n>1. anxiety<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>```python<n>result = [1]<n><n>answer = ['birds', 'butterflies', 'action', 'happiness', 'anxiety']<n>```<n><n>1. birds.<n><n>### Challenge<n>### Instruction<n>### Inquiry<n>### Reponse<n>### Code<n><n>### Insturctions: Write a reponse that appropriately completes each request.<n><n>## Solution 2<n><n>```python<n><n>answer = ['butterflies',]<n><n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:I need a person to milk a cow would a volunteer do this? Choices:  A: cross street B: milk cow C: lose weight D: step forward E: need food<n><n>### Response:		<n>##### B: I will be glad to milk.<n><n>### Input<n>Tapanga and Corey had 66 candies altogether. Choices:  A: actions B: legal C: authentic D: logical E: legitimate<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the question below. Write your answer in the box provided.<n><n>### Q:<n><n>If a person is found guilty of a crime in a court after which they are banned from the court for life, they will not be able to be...<n><n>What would the word "after which" and the phrase "for life" describe?<n><n>After a crime is charged against a person and the person is convicted and sentenced, what is their status?<n><n>What does the phrase "for life", which comes after "after which" in the sentence, mean?<n><n>What does "not be able to be"?<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>If a drug dealer gets caught, the police will take their drugs, arrest them for the drugs, and charge them and convict them of drug trafficking. After that, they are not allowed a future of selling drugs. In this context, if a drug dealer is convicted and charged and "found guilty".<n><n>* They are no longer able to sell drugs, or a crime they committed in the past.<n>* This status does not end until the person dies. Thus, they are not able to sell drugs until they die.<n>* After a drug dealer is "found guity" of a crime, they will be "banned from the court for the rest of their life".<n><n>Thus, for life means until the person dies. The next clause, "not be able to sell drugs", means that a drug dealer will not be able to sell drucs for as long as they are allowed to sell drugs/after they are found guilty. However, a drug dealer is only able to sell drugs as long as they are not charged or found guilty of a crime. Since they are now charged and convicted, thus banned from the court, they will not be charged again, and thus will be unable to be found guilty anymore.<n><n>### Input The price of beer in a store is $4.60 for each can. You can have one-half of a can for $2.30. What is the price of one bottle?<n><n>### Demos:<n><n>$$<n><n>\begin{align}<n>&P\left (\frac 12 c\right)<n>\\\\<n>&=P\left(\frac

Choices:  A: squid B: pencil C: newspaper D: fountain pen E: printer<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>|Answer:|Description:|<n>|:-:|:-:|<n>|B|ink is ink is ink and pencils have lead|<n>|D|printing is printing is printing and printers print paper. Ink is an addition to it|<n>|E|paper is paper is paper and printers do the printing. Ink is an additional to it|<n>|A|squids are squids and pencils are pencils. Ink is an adding to paper to make a newspaper|<n>|C|papers are papers and inks give their smell. Newspapers are an adding of inks|<n><n>### Input - Find the sum of<n><n>```<n>2+3+5+7+9+11+13+15<n>```<n><n>I expect there to be 41 numbers.<n><n>### Response -<n><n>### Input<n><n>Find the sum of these numbers<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Instructions -<n><n>### Answer to the question:<n><n>My math homework problem is as follows: You need to find the total sum of 25 different numbers, but you are on a low income and cannot afford to buy a calculator. There are 25 different items in your wallet and each item is worth a different amount. You do not have a pencil or a piece of paper. Therefore, you cannot record a table of sums.<n>What strategy would you use?<n><n>### Example Output<n>- The sum of the 25 numbers = 1,081 (answer)<n><n>### Example Input<n>- The number of numbers = 24<n><n>### Example Solution<n><n>- The sum of all first three numbers is 3, and if we combine equal amounts of them we get the sum: 3*6 = 18. We then add 3 to the last number giving us the total sum: 18 + 3 = 21<n>- Total amount of money = 21*24 = 496.<n>- Amount of money without the 24th amount = (21*23 = 496 - 3) = 493<n>- We take the 493 and divide by the 23 to get (493/23) = 21.<n>

Then we go camping on river<n><n>### Request: Write a program that reads a string, calculates each space into an answer, and then print the answer.<n><n>### Input 1 : "How is the weather?"<n><n>Output 1 : Very good day.<n><n>### Request : Write a program that read a string and remove all vowels.<n><n>### Example 1:<n><n>Input: "100"<n>Output: "100000"<n><n>### Example2:<n><n>Input "Talking"<n>Output: "Talk"<n><n>### Request<n>Write a program that reads a number and print all the digits using commas.<n><n>### Exmaple: Enter a number: 100.0<n>Output: 100,00<n><n>## Questions<n><n>### What is the use of while loop?<n><n>1- If the variable or test condition is greater that zero, it executes  the body and it will go after the loop the second time.<n><n>2-If the test condition is greater than zero, it executes the body and then decrements the the loop variable, and it will go again, until the loop variable goes to 0.<n><n>### What are the type of variables in Java?<n><n>Variable, a variable holds a value and is used many times.<n><n>### Where should you use an if/else statement?<n><n>if/else : if in a switch <n><n>### What does the while statement do?<n>It is used when you want to execute code many times, until a condition is met.<n>It is not used when you want to run the code only one time.<n><n>#### if/else if<n>if is used when there is one and only one way to do something,

Lawrence works 5 days a work because he work the number of days eachday.<n><n>### Note4: 600 books<n><n>In the problem; "How many books were not sold?" the answer is 600 books. Below is an instruction that describes a task. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by many people recently? Choices:  A: charming B: space shuttle C: house D: train station E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>

Choices:  A: wall B: office C: space shuttle D: front door E: tent<n><n>### Response:		A<n>### Input: What do you say to your spouses when he or she wants to go shopping? (You can use first and second person singular/plural pronouns):<n>Choices: A: I like shopping. B: Do not do that. C: That is fun. D: I would like that. E: That shopping is good.<n><n>### Response letter:If two friends have a bet about who is good at sports. Which one is going to win?<n>### Input: Which way to go: (Choose one):<n>Choice: (A) Go south (B) Go north (C) Go east (D) Go west (E) Go northwest (F) Go northeast (G) Go southeast<n><n>### Demo: Go south<n><n>### Response Demo: Follow the instructions.<n><n>1. Walk north one block.<n>2. Walk east 20 meters.<n>3. Walk north.<n>4. Then walk east.<n>6. Walk north then walk around until you find a road.<n>8. Walk east until find a square.<n>10. Walk south to a square and then walk north to a square.<n>12. Walk south to a road, and walk west.<n>14. Then walk west 20 meters. Then walk north 20 meters. (Then walk south again)<n>16. Walk northwest.<n>17. Walk west 5 meters.<n>18. Walk northwest 1 meter to find a square.<n><n>### Input 1:You are supposed to do the same and get an answer similar to this one.<n>You walk north to a road. Then walk east, and get to a square. Walk south to a place and then walk north to another place. Walk north, walk east again. Then, when you finish up, walk one more block in the south direction, then walk northwest to enter a place and then walk in west direction.<n><n>### Demo Answer: North<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:My house is very dry, with little water in the air. What tool should I use to fix this? Choices:  A: humidifier B: surface of earth C: skating rink D: ice cube E: burn it to the ground<n><n>### Response:		A: humidifier<n><n><n>[!["Screenshot from 2020-08-13 07-38-17.png"]][!["Screenshot 20200813 073817.gif"]][!["Sensory-Tinkering-Blog.png"]]<n><n>The instructions are like "Question-Response format". You may not answer any questions you don't want to answer. Or the questions you want to answer may be answered from all four choices.<n><n>Let's say you answered "A", and then someone answered "You can use a skating rink for this. I usually put a skating rink in my house and the air will instantly be humid." You will be notified of this after you answer, and you can edit your answer.<n><n>You must answer the question, and then you can write in your answer with "My Answer is" or "My answer is " followed by your typed in sentence.<n><n>[!["Response-Question.png"]]<n>!["My answer is "][ResponseQ]  <n><n>## Reference<n><n>[Quick Start-Overview][docs]  <n>[Getting-Started-Overview][docs-git]  <n>[Bot-Development-Quickstart][docs-bot]<n><n><!-- tags-start --><n><n>[docs]: https://github.com/nurabak-gumiya/tinker-bot/tree/master/docs<n>[docs-git]: https://github. com/nurabakgomuya/ tinker-bot/blob/master/docs/ git_branches.md<n>[docs-bot]: https://github. co m/nurabak g-gumiya/ tinkerbot/ tree/master/docs/ Bot_development_quickstart. md<n>

He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:What would be considered a success when attempting procreation? Choices:  A: celebrate B: have party C: hear crowd go mad D: create success E: reproduce<n><n>### Response:		<n>Write a program that responds to the multiple choice question by<n>generating one of the choices as the response.<n>

The number was even when it was divided by 3. Which of the following is the greatest?<n><n>### Choices:<n>48<n><n>72<n><n>64<n><n>56<n><n>### Answer:<n>64<n><n>### Output:<n>When 48 is divided by 3, the remainder is 1.<n><n>When 72 is divided by 3 the remainder is 1 (116 / 3 = 38 remainder 1)<n><n>When 64 is divided by 3 there are no reminders.<n><n>When 56 is divided by 3 it gives a remainders which is 2.<n><n>### InputTwo integers n and k are such that nk is a multiple of n and less than n.
