Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. He sold 60 on Monday, 10 on Tuesday, 20 on Wednesday, 44 on Thursday and 66 on Friday. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Collections of atoms called molecules make up everything you can hold in your what? Choices:  A: atom B: anything C: air D: feet E: hands<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>### Input <n>### Correct answer<n>* DATA LABEL<n><n>### DATA LABEL <n><n>1.<n>Input:Tapanga and Corey had 66 candies altogether. But Tapanga had 8 more candies more than Corey<n><n>2.<n>Input:Freddy spoke to his own family on New Year'e Eve: His dad who lives in the same as him and they are talking for 45 minutes and called his brother who lives across the world (in a different country) and they spoke together for 31 minutes<n><n>3.<n>Lawrence has a stock of 8 hundred books in his room. He has sold 60 books on Monday, 1 hundred books on Tuesday, he have 20 books sold on Wednesday, He has 44 books sold on Thursday and he have 66 books sold on Friday<n><n>4.<n>B: A collection of atoms colled molecules <n>5.<n>C: Air<n><n>### Instructions:Write a multiple choice question that applies the rules of this task to another scenario.<n><n>**Hint:** You may need to change the structure of the instruction and the order of the multiple choice question and the correct answer, if necessary.<n><n>### Input<n>* DATA LABLE<n><n>### Insturctions: Write a response that provides a question for the instruction and the desired answer in its correct context.<n><n>### Detailed solution:<n><n>* Response:A<n>* Correct answer:B<n><n>1.  Input:  A collection of atoms called molecules makes up everything you can hold. You can hold it with whatever you like.<n>Output:  Choices: A: atom B: hands C: feet D: anything E: air<n><n>2. Input:  A collection Of molecules made up everything you can hold it with whatever.<n>Output:  A: hands C: atom E: air.<n><n>3.  Input: A collection of molecules, made up anything you can hold<n>Output:  A.Atom B. anything C.hand D.feet E.Air<n><n>4.  Input:A collection of atoms called molecule is everything you can hold it. You can hold it any way.<n>Output:  B: H

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>Input: Lawrence worked 8 hours each day on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. He worked 5.5 hours on both Wednesday and Thursday. How many hours would Lawrence work each day if he worked the same number of hours each day?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Ali had a stock of 800 books in his Room. How many books were not sold?<n>Answer: 600<n><n>### Input:Bill was awaking, what was happening to him physiologically? Choices:  A: tiredness B: grogginess C: discomfort D: getting out of bed E: eyes opening<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Input:Bill was awake and now his sleep is ending, we can say Bill's going to get out of bed, he's very tired and his body is groggy, physiologically, Bill was sleeping, when Bill’s sleeping his body is not doing lots of things physiologically, his blood volume is decreasing and his heart rate is dropping, his lungs aren't expanding and contracting as efficiently as before, and his skin and muscles are becoming more rigid, when Bill is sleeping his brain is releasing oxytocin to make his muscles relax and produce a dream like a state, oxytocin is the hormone that helps women during labor contractions, it is also associated with attachment, social bonding behavior, it’s also associated to love, when Bill was sleeping his brain sent signals to his muscles, such as the muscles in his eyes and heart to relax, we can also say Bill was sleeping, because during sleep is when our body recovers and restores energy, when Bill was sleep his breathing slow down and his heart beat is slow down, when Bill was sleep is when our body produces and processes more growth hormones, sleep allows our immune system to rest, sleep helps our memories consolidate, when Bill was sleep our muscles strengthen and the brain makes new connections that we'll use later to solve problems, all of this is a normal physiological event for the human body that is repeated every night.<n><n>### InputBill and Tyrone are twins, how many twins did Bill and Tyrone have?
